title: Ocean's 13
content:
Going to see it today, can't wait. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] I really like the 11 and 12, the 11 being one of my favourite movies. Also, even if I don't really care about actors, these movies have many good actors that fit in their role perfectly. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] The movie hits the theaters today.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Ocean's 13
content:
Well, I liked it, but the first of them is certainly the best.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Ocean's 13
content: I've enjoyed the first two movies, despite the nonsensical element of adding one person to the team each time just to fit the title.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rolleyes.gif[/img]  I'll definitely be watching 13 as soon as I can. I have higher expectations for this than I do for Pirates 3.

title: Re: Ocean's 13
content:
Pirates 3 was an absolute disaster... of course, I've never seen the first two.

But Ocean's 13 was as average as average can get.

title: Re: Ocean's 13
content:
Calling Pirates 3 "an absolute disaster" when you haven't seen the first two seems kind of silly. Unlike movies that don't really need sequels (like Oceans 13, which I enjoyed, none-the-less), Pirates 3 was the conclusion of a story arc. It's like reading Return of the King without having more than heard the name of Frodo before and thinking it's a disaster, as you have no idea of the aims and driving forces of the characters.--------------------
